Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

It all started with one person because that's how these things usually go. A single individual, possessing a spark of Mana, encounters a few others who also have small glimmers.

It took time. Rome wasn't built in a day, after all.

But it's all about perseverance, independence, and passion.

It took time. Rome wasn't built in a day, after all.

But it's all about perseverance, independence, and passion.

This single individual, who lived in a cave with his people, woke up one day and realized that the life he was living was not the one that he was destined to have. He knew that he was worth more than what he was doing. 

He knew that the Mana was being wasted on the people around him. He had heard the history of his people a thousand times, and knew that Mana was supposedly gone forever - this was not true, though.

He had retained his power and harnessed it.

And he met people. Far and wide. He traveled, and each person he found with a spark of Mana, he took them under his wing.

He trained.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

It all started with one person because that's how these things usually go. A single individual, possessing a spark of Mana, encounters a few others who also have small glimmers.

It all started with one person because that's how these things usually go. A single individual, possessing a spark of Mana, encounters a few others who also have small glimmers.

It took time. Rome wasn't built in a day, after all.

But it's all about perseverance, independence, and passion.

This single individual, who lived in a cave with his people, woke up one day and realized that the life he was living was not the one that he was destined to have. He knew that he was worth more than what he was doing. 

He knew that the Mana was being wasted on the people around him. He had heard the history of his people a thousand times, and knew that Mana was supposedly gone forever - this was not true, though.

He had retained his power and harnessed it.

And he met people. Far and wide. He traveled, and each person he found with a spark of Mana, he took them under his wing.

He trained. He listened. He carried on. H
